greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n*(Pisano period of n) divided by (Pisano period of n^2).
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Arpan Saha and C. S. Karthik, A few equivalences of Wall-Sun-Sun prime conjecture, arXiv:1102.1636 [math.NT], 2011.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pisano period.
mathematica: pp[1] = 1; pp[n_] := For[k = 1, True, k++, If[Mod[Fibonacci[k], n] == 0 && Mod[Fibonacci[k+1], n] == 1, Return[k]]];
program: entry_p(p)=my(k=1, c=Mod(1, p), o); while(c, [o, c]=[c, c+o]; k++); k
per(n)=if(n==1, return(1)); my(k=entry(n)); forstep(i=k, n^2, k, if(fibmod(i-1, n)==1, return(i)))
results.author: _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 13 2014
